Mental Imagery.description: The process of creating sensory experiences in the mind in the absence of external sensory input.

Sensory Input.description: Sensory information from the environment that can influence mental imagery.

Memory Recall.description: Retrieval of stored information from memory to construct mental images.

Visual Cortex Activity.description: Neural activity in the visual cortex related to processing visual information, including mental imagery.

Auditory Cortex Activity.description: Neural activity in the auditory cortex related to processing auditory information, including mental imagery.

Long-Term Memory.description: Long-term storage of information, including memories that can be used to form mental images.

Working Memory.description: Temporary storage and manipulation of information, crucial for constructing and maintaining mental images.

Visual Perception.description: The process of interpreting visual information, influencing the quality of mental images.

Auditory Perception.description: The process of interpreting auditory information, influencing the quality of mental images.

Cognitive Load.description: The amount of mental resources used, affecting the ability to maintain and manipulate mental images.

Attention.description: The selective concentration of consciousness, influencing the clarity and detail of mental images.

Semantic Memory.description: Knowledge about the world, influencing the content and accuracy of mental images.

Episodic Memory.description: Memories of personal experiences, which can be used to create vivid and detailed mental images.

Image Clarity.description: The degree of distinctness and detail in a mental image.

Image Detail.description: The level of specific information present in a mental image.

Sound Clarity.description: The degree of distinctness and detail in a mental sound.

Sound Detail.description: The level of specific information present in a mental sound.

Mental Fatigue.description: Mental tiredness that impairs the ability to create and maintain mental images.

Focus.description: Concentration improves the clarity and detail of mental images.

Distraction.description: Interference that impairs the ability to create and maintain mental images.

Conceptual Knowledge.description: General knowledge that informs mental imagery.

General Knowledge.description: General knowledge that informs mental imagery.

Personal Experiences.description: Personal experiences that provide rich content for mental imagery.

Specific Events.description: Specific events that provide rich content for mental imagery.

Vividness.description: The intensity and richness of a mental image.

Sharpness.description: The clarity and definition of a mental image.

Color.description: The presence and intensity of colors in a mental image.

Texture.description: The perceived surface quality of a mental image.

Pitch.description: The highness or lowness of a mental sound.

Volume.description: The loudness of a mental sound.

Timbre.description: The quality of a mental sound that distinguishes it from other sounds of the same pitch and loudness.

Rhythm.description: The pattern of sounds in a mental sound.

Reduced Image Quality.description: A decrease in the clarity and detail of a mental image.

Difficulty Maintaining Images.description: Inability to maintain a mental image for an extended period.

Improved Image Quality.description: An increase in the clarity and detail of a mental image.

Enhanced Detail.description: Increased level of specific information in a mental image.

Image Disruption.description: Interruption or distortion of a mental image.

Schema.description: A cognitive framework or concept that helps organize and interpret information.

Facts.description: Pieces of information that are known to be true.

Information.description: Data or knowledge that is communicated or received.

Emotional Content.description: The emotional significance of a personal experience.

Sensory Details.description: Specific sensory information associated with a personal experience.

Time.description: The temporal context of a specific event.

Location.description: The spatial context of a specific event.
